definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
to whistle down the wind/to waste one's breath (idiom)

sentences.english: The papal captain have vainly endeavoured to induce his wife to remain behind him .
sentences.chinese: 教廷的队长曾白费力气地试图说服妻子留下不去。

sentences.english: But now it eems that all the hard work may have been in vain.
sentences.chinese: 但现在看来，所有的努力都可能白费了。

sentences.english: You are wasting your breath; he won't change his mind.
sentences.chinese: 你在白费口舌，他不会改变主的。

sentences.english: Governments waste a lot of breath on their plans to make the economy more competitive.
sentences.chinese: 政府在使经济更具竞争性方面的计划白费了很多唇舌。

sentences.english: It does not help asking the question once your anger has been aroused.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你的愤怒被激起，问你什么问题都是白费力气。

sentences.english: I had worked for what seemed like nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我所努力的最后似乎都白费了。

sentences.english: Your efforts will go to waste if you give it up.
sentences.chinese: 你要是放弃，心血就会白费。

sentences.english: His failure made a mockery of his friend's great efforts to help him.
sentences.chinese: 他的失败使他的朋友帮助他的一番心血白费了。

sentences.english: My efforts were not in vain.
I've already made up my mind. There's no sense flogging a dead horse .
sentences.chinese: 我已经下了决心，不必再白费口舌了。

sentences.english: Asking him is wasting my breath.
I tryed very hard to persuade him to quit smoking,but to no purpose.
sentences.chinese: 我说服他戒烟，但却白费力气。

sentences.english: Save your breath, the boss will never give you the day off.
sentences.chinese: 别白费口舌了，老板不会给你假的。

sentences.english: Final results showed that we beat our head against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 但是最后结果表明我们白费力气了。

sentences.english: So you see , my dear , you ' ve abased yourself to no purpose.
sentences.chinese: 你看，亲爱的，你白费一番苦心贬低自己了。

sentences.english: All of that is wasted effort.
sentences.chinese: 所有那一切都是白费力气。

definition: to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to waste (one's breath, one's energy etc)/to try in vain
painstaking effort/to take a lot of trouble/laborious at pains
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
to pay/to invest (energy or time in a friendship etc)
exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
